Stefano Meschiari, Ph.D.

Product Data Scientist at Civitas Learning

Hello there! I am a Data Scientist at Civitas Learning. I am also a maker of open-source scientific tools and games, an open data enthusiast, and all-around tech geek.

As a data scientist, I research novel ways to help universities improve their students' success. As an astronomer, I discovered new planets and worked on understanding how Tatooine-like planets (planets orbiting binary stars) formed.

My Resume

Quick stats

Living in Austin, Texas

Hailing from Modena, Italy

Astrophysics Ph.D.

Data Scientist & Software developer

Interests

Machine learning, visualization, creating tooling for data analysis, web development, gamified education, open data and open-source development, citizen science and science education.

Skills

Machine learning, numerical algorithms, data analysis and visualization

Expert in using R and the modern R package ecosystem for data analysis tasks and numerical prototyping, data visualizations, data wrangling, and as a glue language to interface with C, Java and Fortran packages. Proficient in Spark with Scala, PostgreSQL, and Matlab.

Software engineering

Expert in writing high-performance, parallelized numerical libraries and simulation code in C and Java, and creating data analysis prototypes and UIs in R, JavaScript, Lua, and Scala. Expert in designing high-level user interfaces (both web and desktop-based) to easily drive complex data analysis tasks for both domain experts and novices. Other languages: Java, C, Fortran.

Web development

Proficient in the ES6/Node.js ecosystem, including React, Express, Bootstrap. Other tools: Apache Cordova, PostgreSQL, Backbone.js, Paper.js, HighCharts, UIKit, and Semantic UI.
